stanza.line: I have never known peace

line.litDevice: Like the damp grass that yields to me

stanza.line: I have never known hunger

line.litDevice: Like these insects that feast on me

stanza.line: A thousand teeth
And yours among them, I know
Our hungers appeased
Our heartbeats becoming slow
We'll lay here for years or for hours
Thrown here of found, to freeze or to thaw

line.litDevice: So long, we'd become the flowers
Two corpses we were, two corpses I saw

stanza.line: And they'd find us in a week
When the weather gets hot
After the insects have made their claim
I'd be home with you, I'd be home with you
I have never known sleep

line.litDevice: Like this slumber that creeps to me

stanza.line: I have never known colour

line.litDevice: Like this morning reveals to me

stanza.line: And you haven't moved an inch
Such that I would not know
If you sleep alwyas like this
The flesh calmly going cold
We'll lay here for years or for hours
Your hand in my hand, so still and discreet

line.litDevice: So long, we'd become the flowers
We'd feed well the land and worry the sheep

stanza.line: And they'd find us in a week
When the cattle show fear
After the insects have made their claim
After the foxes have known our taste
I'd be home with you, I'd be home with you...
They'd find us in a week (We lay here for years or for hours)
When the weather gets hot (So long we become the flowers)
And they'd find us in a week (We lay here for years of for hours)
When the cattle show fear (So long we become the flowers)
And they'd find us in a week
When the buzzards get loud
After the insects have made their claim
After the foxes have known our taste

line.litDevice: And the raven has had his say

stanza.line: I'd be home with you, I'd be home with you
